greenmirror.server

Class Visualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • greenmirror.server.Visualizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VisualizerMemento.Caretaker, VisualizerMemento.Originator

    public class Visualizer
extends Application
implements VisualizerMemento.Caretaker, VisualizerMemento.Originator
    The main visualizer class and JavaFX application. It starts the log window and waits for connections.
    Author:
    Karim El Assal

      An abstract state class in accordance with the state design pattern.

      • getCurrentMementoIndex

        public int getCurrentMementoIndex()
        Returns the index of the current memento. Mementos store the transition data to transition to the next memento. This means that if we're at the final state (memento), there is no saved memento, only a previous one.
        Returns:
        the current memento index(/number)

      • hasNextMemento

        public boolean hasNextMemento()
        Returns:
        whether there exists a next memento

      • getNextMemento

        Returns:

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no current memento

      • toNextMemento

        public void toNextMemento()
        Transitions to the next state. Any code that needs to be executed after the transition has finished should be set with getNextMemento().getTransition().setOnFinished(...).

      • toPreviousMemento

        public void toPreviousMemento()
        Transitions to the previous state. Any code that needs to be executed after the transition has finished should be set with getPreviousMemento().getTransition().setOnFinished(...).

      • restoreFromMemento

        public void restoreFromMemento(@NonNull VisualizerMemento memento)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        memento - the memento that provides the data for the state.

      • transitionFinished

        public void transitionFinished(@NonNull Transition transition,
                               boolean goingForward)
        Executes when a transition has finished. It also enables or disables the toolbar buttons based on the current playback state and transitions to the next state if the playback state is continuous (and a next state exists).
        Parameters:
        transition - the Transition that just finished
        goingForward - true if we are/were going forward; false if backward

      • updateMementoNumberInfo

        public void updateMementoNumberInfo()
        Updates the memento number in the toolbar.

      • updatePlaybackStateInfo

        public void updatePlaybackStateInfo()
        Updates the playback state information in the toolbar.

      • setFxNodeVisibility

        private void setFxNodeVisibility(@NonNull Transition transition,
                                 boolean isStarting)
        Sets the JavaFX nodes that will appear or disappear to (respectively) visible or invisible. It recursively searches for any FadeTransitions. If isStarting is set to true, we assume this method is executed right before the start of an animation. If set to false, we assume this method is executed right after the and of an animation.
        Parameters:
        transition - any kind of Transition
        isStarting - true if we're starting an animation; false if an animation has just ended

      • setFxNodeVisibilityRecursively

        private void setFxNodeVisibilityRecursively(@NonNull Transition transition,
                                            boolean isStarting,
                                            double rate)
        The actual recursive method of setFxNodeVisibility(Transition, boolean). This method takes an extra parameter: the rate of the animation which is only set at the root animation. This is done because when the FadeTransition is found, the direction of the animation is determined via the rate of the root animation.
        Parameters:
        transition - any kind of Transition
        isStarting - true if we're starting an animation; false if an animation has just ended
        rate - the rate with which the animation will progress or has progressed

      • doPlacement

        public void doPlacement(@NonNull Relation relation)
        Executes the placing of node A onto node B according to the settings of a Relation.
        Parameters:
        relation - the Relation

      • changeFx

        public void changeFx(@NonNull Node node,
                     @NonNull Map<String,Object> newFxMap)
        Changes the FX of a node according to a given map of values. null values are ignored. If the node is already shown on the canvas (its position was set), then the changes are animated. If it isn't already shown, the changes are simply set and if it's shown after the new values are set, a fade in is added. Also, the placement is re-calculated of rigidly related nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - the node that will have its FX changed
        newFxMap - the map with new values

      • executeOnCorrectThread

        public void executeOnCorrectThread(@NonNull Runnable code)
        Executes code for the visualizer on the correct thread.
        Parameters:
        code - the Runnable code to be executed

      • start

        public void start(Stage primaryStage)
        This is the main entry point for the JavaFX application. It starts the log window, parses the arguments and if the arguments are valid, starts listening for connections.
        Specified by:
        start in class Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - the primary stage received from the JavaFX thread

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the visualizer as a preparation for a new connection.

      • listTransitions

        public static Object listTransitions(Transition transitions)
        A (recursive) debug method for checking which transitions are inside sequential and parallel transitions.
        Parameters:
        transitions - the main transition. Probably a sequential or parallel one
        Returns:
        a Map if it's a SequentialTransition or ParallelTransition; a String if it's any other (standalone) transition.
